issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/adguard-%E5%BA%83%E5%91%8A%E3%83%96%E3%83%AD%E3%83%83%E3%82%AB%E3%83%BC/bgnkhhnnamicmpeenaelnjfhikgbkllg](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchromewebstore.google.com%2Fdetail%2Fadguard-%25E5%25BA%2583%25E5%2591%258A%25E3%2583%2596%25E3%2583%25AD%25E3%2583%2583%25E3%2582%25AB%25E3%2583%25BC%2Fbgnkhhnnamicmpeenaelnjfhikgbkllg) ### Comment > Hello. > > This Issue is not a filter issue, but rather a report of a malfunction in the Google Chrome extension AdGuard Ad Blocker MV3 Stable 5.0.161. > > I contacted the AdGuard support team `(support@adguard.com)` and they replied that they needed additional information about the operating environment and asked me to report it using their dedicated reporting tool, so I am reporting it here again. > > The specific symptoms of the supposed bug are as follows. > The images with AdGuard turned on/off are identical. > Clicking on the ‚ÄúOpen Editor in New Window‚Äù icon in the User Rules section does not work and does not allow the editor to open in a new window. > > We would appreciate it if you could fix this problem. ### Screenshots
